page.title: 11TYRREL'S WOOD HARDWICK AREA
page.content: Tyrrel's Wood,covering an area of about 70 acres is 1 of the 20 most important woods in Norfolk on account of the great variety of trees mainly deciduous with a few conifers,about 20 different species were counted including Silver Birch,Oak,Hornbeam, Holly,unusually large Rowans & a large Black Poplar.Many are old,some dead & fallen,dead Elms are being cleared to let in light & encourage plants & wildlife,but everywhere there is natural regeneration by seedlings.Dry & overgrown in places,wet in others, there are shrubs,ferns,many kinds of woodland & wetland plants & some fungi.There is evidence of grey squirrels,rabbits & moles;few birds seen but GoldCrests & other species heard.In a dead tree several holes made by Woodpeckers are evident.There is agricultural land around the wood
